doc.source_uri: 2026-06-30/China Reinsurance Group - H First Take Solid earnings beat in 1H25 Rmb6.6B 11 oya vs. JPMe 5.9BChina Reinsurance Group -_2026-06-30

passages.text: First Take: Solid earnings Beat in 1H26 (Rmb6.6B, \(11\%\) oya vs. JPMc: 5.9B

Our First Take: China Re delivered a solid 1H25 result, achieving a highquality earnings beat. The stock is trading at 6x FY26E P/E with a \(4\%\) yield. We anticipate a positive market response to the company's result. First, the company reported Rmb6.6B of 1H25 net profit (11% oya), which exceeded our forecast (Rmb5.9B). The earnings beat was largely supported by favorable combined ratio management, with ratios below \(100\%\) across major segments. As 1H25 net profit accounts for \(67\%\) of the annual earnings consensus, we foresee potential for upward earnings revisions. Second, management reaffirmed the product portfolio shift towards more profitable overseas business in a prudent manner, and its confidence in achieving underwriting profit amidst softening reinsurance pricing. Third, solvency capital remains robust (Group's Jun- 25 core solvency: \(161\%\) , \(+2\%\) p H/H) with a \(3.7\%\) H/H increase in book value. We believe that the solid earnings beat and consensus revisions could drive share outperformance. Stay OW.

1H25 NP rose by \(11\%\) oya to Rmb6.6B, which exceeded our estimates of Rmb5.9B. We think the earnings base was largely underpinned by an impressive management of the combined ratio. Despite the global insured catastrophic loss in 1H25 reaching the highest level (US100B+) over the past decade, which exerted certain pressure on the claim ratio, the company sustained a favorable combined ratio of overseas reinsurance business and Chaucer business at \(100.1\% /84.4\%\) , respectively. Regarding the scaling of the Chaucer business, management noted that the company is likely to pursue prudent underwriting selection, further enhancing its resilience against catastrophic fluctuations. Moreover, the softening global reinsurance pricing cycle may not weigh on the underwriting business, as the company believes that current pricing still reserves sufficient buffer to generate plausible underwriting profit.

In the low interest rate environment, the declining interest rate and capital gain of the bond portfolio weakened the annualized investment yield to \(4.3\%\) in 1H25, down from \(4.7\%\) in 1H24. We think this metric deserves close monitoring, as total investment income is crucial for earnings to strengthen.
We anticipate near- term upward revision on full year consensus as 1H25 net profit makes up \(67\%\) of the current FY25E consensus NP.
1508. HK, 1508 HK Price: HK\(1.71 29 Aug 2025 Price Target: HK\)2.10 PT End Date: 30 Jun 2026
We expect a positive share price reaction to the earnings beat.
Table 1: China Re: Earnings table Rmb in million, \(\%\)

1H241H25Y/YInsurance revenue51,78451,056-1%Interest income4,5444,5961%Other investment return3,8214,25611%Other income563516-8%Total income60,68661,0281%-External income60,68661,0281%-Interm-segment income---Insurance service expenses(48,478)(47,618)-2%Allocation of reinsurance premiums(4,696)(4,604)-2%Amounts recoverable from reinsurers4,2883,813-11%Finance expenses from insurance contracts issued(2,897)(3,521)22%Finance income/(expenses) from reinsurance contracts held39465266%Net impairment loss on financial assets(81)66-182%Other finance cost(1,026)(933)-9%Other operating and administrative expenses(1,854)(1,827)-1%Total insurance service expenses and others-54,350-53,972-1%Share of profit of associates1,0771,0891%Profit before tax7,4148,14510%Income tax(1,492)(1,546)4%Net profit5,9226,59911%
Source: China Re's 1H25 interim report.
Figure 1: China Re: combined ratio across business lines %

Source: China Re's 1H25 interim report. Note: P&C Reinsurance -Overseas business here excludes Chaucer. 1H24 Combined is restated as the formula of Combined ratio is revised for better comparison with global reinsurers. Combined ratio = (insurance service expenses - recoverable from reinsurers) + (insurance revenue - allocation of reinsurance premiums)

China Reinsurance Group is a leading reinsurer in Mainland China, ranking No.1 in Asia and No.8 in the global reinsurance market on a premium basis. It has firmly established its dominant position in China's reinsurance market, with a nearly

50% market share in 2024 (22% on B&C Re and 28% on Life Re). We have an OW rating on China Re due to its scarcity value for equity investors on: (1) its distinctive product offering to relieve life insurers' capital stress; (2) excess growth print potential vs. primary insurer through market cycles; and (3) diversified business risk and foreign exchange hedging benefits thanks to overseas exure.

We adopt a P/E valuation methodology for China Re. China's insurance sector has de-rated over the last few years. We believe the company might be on a trajectory of valuation multiple recovery following strong underwriting upside risk from excess business growth potential, and thus we assign a 7x FY26E P/E (between the historical average/minimum level of 8x/2x) to arrive at our Jun-26 PT of HK$2.1.
Valuation summary (HK$)
FY24FY25EFY26EFY27EEPS (HK$)0.270.280.310.32Target P/E7xHistorical avg./min. P/E8x/2xValue per share (Dec-26) (HK$)2.15Time factor0.96Jun-26 PT (HK$)2.1
Source: China Re's 2024 annual report, J.P. Morgan estimates.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analyst's coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
